doc.after: The Song military was chiefly organized to ensure that the army could not threaten Imperial control often at the expense of effectiveness in war Northern Song s Military Council operated under a Chancellor who had no control over the imperial army The imperial army was divided among three marshals each independently responsible to the Emperor Since the Emperor rarely led campaigns personally Song forces lacked unity of command 93 The imperial court often believed that successful generals endangered royal authority and relieved or even executed them notably Li Gang 94 Yue Fei and Han Shizhong 95
